thread.title: The 5 Most Upscale Stadiums for Foodies

author: Ari Bendersky
title: The 5 Most Upscale Stadiums for Foodies

organizations.name: cal sport media/alamy stock photo staples center illustration

text:
5 COMMENTS AT&T Park Illustration: Drue Wagner Home Team: San Francisco Giants (MLB)
Opened: 2000
Slam-Dunk: The Crazy Crab’z Sandwich, made with Dungeness crab on toasted and buttered sourdough.
Curveball: Upgrade your ice cream and grab a hot-fudge sundae by San Francisco local Ghirardelli.
Thirst Quencher: Silver Oak Cab by the glass at Vintage ’58 Wine Bar.
Bonus Points: A 4,320-square-foot working culinary garden with raised beds and aeroponic towers sits behind center field.
Staples Center Photo: Cal Sport Media/Alamy Stock Photo Staples Center Illustration: Drue Wagner Home Team: L.A. Lakers (NBA); L.A. Clippers (NBA)
Opened: 1999
Slam-Dunk: Ludo Lefebvre’s buttermilk Provençal fried chicken and honey lavender biscuits at Ludo Bird.
Curveball: Trade the Cracker Jack for churros from Ray Garcia’s B.S. Taqueria.
Thirst Quencher: Smokin’ Sunset, Staples’ signature cocktail, made with Absolut Elyx vodka and smoke-infused blood- orange lemonade.
Bonus Points: The private Lexus Club has an exclusive dining room and a 65-seat outdoor terrace overlooking downtown L.A.
Citi Field Photo: Maurice Savage/Alamy Stock Photo Citi Field Home Team: New York Mets (MLB)
Opened: 2009
Slam-Dunk: Danny Meyer rules the roost with Shake Shack , Blue Smoke and El Verano Taqueria.
Curveball: Ballpark nachos get a gourmet lift with lobster at Catch of the Day.
Thirst Quencher: Vodka lemonade from the Tito’s stand.
Bonus Points: The new 10,000-square-foot brewery by cult Danish beer-maker Mikkeller has over 60 brews on tap.
Mercedes Benz Stadium Photo: Martin Thomas Photography/Alamy Stock Photo Mercedes-Benz Stadium Home Team: Atlanta Falcons (NFL), Atlanta United FC (MLS)
Illustration: Drue Wagner Opened: 2017
Slam-Dunk: Kevin Gillespie’s slow-roastedpork shoulder French dip at Gamechanger.
Curveball: Skip the soda and sip on cold-pressed juices from Snackology 101.
Thirst Quencher: Craft brews from Athens, Georgia’s Terrapin Beer Co.
Bonus Points: Concession staff is hired via Westside Works’ free six-week culinary training program for local residents.
Wrigley Field Photo: Ron Niebrugge/Alamy Stock Photo Wrigley Field Illustration: Drue Wagner Home Team: Chicago Cubs (MLB)
Opened: 1914
Slam-Dunk: House-made bone-in short ribs; 38-ounce center-cut tomahawk steaks available in suites.
Curveball: Hot Doug’s bleachers-only gourmet sausages trump the standard frank.
Thirst Quencher: Cocktails on tap from Matthias Merges’s Billy Sunday bar.
Bonus Points: The Chef Series returns this summer. Last year’s roster included Rick Bayless, Stephanie Izard and Graham Elliot.
